result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond S Neeser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond S Neeser is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond S Neeser was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Raymond S Neeser in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Raymond S Neeser.  Attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. DISM ct 2. 8 mo DCJ served in WSP cc to any other sentence, cc. Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued. Argument. No restitution. DNA on file. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 2  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   1
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, cs to Waupaca Co cases 14CF244, 14CF198

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription

-Random UA and BA testing at a minimum of once every two weeks
-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time already served:  0
-Days credit if revoked: 0

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Status conference on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE does not have an attorney and needs to apply to SPD. DE did not waive TL. Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits for prelim.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Joseph P.
  - Defendant shall not be at Town Bank.
  - Defendant shall not use or possess any credit cards, debit cards, checks, or other monetary instruments not lawfully in his/her own name.
  Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 11

03:19 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
